alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BIG HORN...EASTERN CARBON... SOUTHERN YELLOWSTONE...CENTRAL ROSEBUD...SOUTHEASTERN TREASURE AND NORTHWESTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 459 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Custer to 11 miles northeast of Horseshoe Bend. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. There is an outflow producing strong winds ahead of the thunderstorms as well. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Billings, Hardin, Lodge Grass, Lockwood, Huntley, Busby, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Worden, Fort Smith, Crow Agency, Billings West End, Ballantine, Pryor, Wyola, Parkman, Pompeys Pillar, Acton, St. Xavier, and Kirby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
